The couple's daughter four-year-old India Rose appeared to be missing from the family affair.
The doting dad is set to spend a lot more time abroad this year as he begins his next project, Avengers: Infinity War, due for release in 2018.
'We shoot Avengers in Atlanta for most of the year actually, but it's sort of pretty spread out throughout the eight months shoot, so I'll be back in Oz a bit,' the Melbourne-born hunk told Today's Richard Wilkins in January.

Close to home: Chris revealed he loved filming Thor: Ragnorak in Queensland as it allowed him to stay close to his family
'That was so good to be able to put the kids in bed every night, in their own bed': he said
Chris also explained the benefits of filming Thor: Ragnorak in Brisbane, as it allowed him to be closer to home.
'That was so good to be able to put the kids in bed every night, in their own bed, and not be in a hotel and be working with the local crews again,' he told Richard.
'It was one of the most enjoyable experiences I've had, a lot of fun,' the movie star added.
